text: When you make a note on a paper not being useful to you, what do you include in the note? The reason I ask is that I often find papers which are not useful to me - _at that moment_. However, they could maybe become useful to me in the future so I don't want to just have a note that says "X paper was not useful to me because it was not what I was looking for" but rather something more informative... Thoughts?

text: Well, if you read enough to get a sense what it was about, write that? But not everything needs to be captured. If you only spent 30 sec on it, spending _another_ 30 sec to note that fact doesn't seem worth it to me
